title: Ticket #5497: test needed for condor_q defaulting to MyJobs only
description:
A test is needed for the new default behavior of condor_q where it will show only the current user's jobs unless told otherwise or the current user is a queue superuser. The test should

One possible way to create a job queue that contains multiple users even when running on a personal condor is to set 

add to condor configuration
QUEUE_ALL_USERS_TRUSTED=True
and then set the owner explicitly in the submit file. 
add to submit file
+owner="fakeuser"

This technique can be used to produce a schedd queue that has multiple users in it. (Note that some, but not all of the jobs in the queue must be owned by the current user). Then the test can

  • run condor_q with no arguments and verify that only jobs owned by the current user are returned.
  • run condor_q <clusterid> and verify that only jobs from that cluster id are returned.
  • repeat the above using a clusterid that is not owned by the current user.
  • run condor_q -all and verify that all jobs are returned
  • run condor_q <username> and verify that only jobs from that user are returned
  • run condor_q <user1> <user2> and verify that only jobs from either of those users are returned.
